title: Analysis of piecewise function graph part - d

content.question: The function g is defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>f</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>r</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5160@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. On what intervals contained in [-4, 6] is the graph of g concave up? Explain your reasoning.

frqParts.text: The function g is defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>f</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>r</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5160@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. On what intervals contained in [-4, 6] is the graph of g concave up? Explain your reasoning.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
